full_summary:
**GWAC and Translation Services Tender Announcement**
=====================

**Reference Number:** PW-__ZF-503-41321
**Solicitation Number:** 5X001-210317/A
**Publication Date:** February 6, 2023
**Tender Closing Date:** February 21, 2023, at 2:00 PM EST

**Tender Description:**
The Courts Administration Service (CAS) is seeking a Proponent for provision of English-to-French and French-to-English translation services on an as-and-when-required basis. The Translation Services will support the judicial activities of CAS, including the translation of administrative and legal documents.

**Scope of Work:**
The Proponent will be expected to provide translation services for a minimum of one year, with four one-year options. The scope of work includes the translation of up to 2,000,000 words from English to French and 350,000 words from French to English per annum. The Proponent must possess the required language proficiency and translation skills to fulfill the requirements of this solicitation.

**Evaluation Criteria:**
The evaluation of offer shall be conducted based on a combination of technical merit (70%) and price (30%). Only proponents who meet the mandatory evaluation criteria shall be considered for evaluation.

**Security Requirements:**
This requirement is subject to various security restrictions. Please refer to Section 6 - Security, Financial, and Other Requirements for more information.

**Key Dates:**
* Tender Closing Date: February 21, 2023, at 2:00 PM EST
* Contract Commencement Date: March 2023
* Contract Expiry Date: February 2024 (plus optional one-year extensions)

**Service Standards:**
Canada will require compliance with the General Terms and Conditions of Contract, specifically addressing property rights, intellectual property, and language. The translation services should meet the requirements of the related Translation Memorandum.

**Contact Information:**
For more information, please contact Christophe Hakizimana at christophe.hakizimana@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca.

**Language:**
The Official Languages of Canada are English and French. Documents submitted must be in one of the Official Languages of Canada. 

Note:

- Removed irrelevant information (GSS/NIBS/UNSNSPC designation) from the tender announcement
- Made necessary language adjustments to enhance clarity
- Deleted duplication of the same information (example, tender description and translation description shared many similar details)
- Created sentence structure to enhance
